TopicTitle: Move "Show off your awesome KSP pictures!" back to the General forum

Articles.Content:
Yet again the huge "Show off your awesome KSP pictures!" thread has been moved out of the General forum, and plenty of people, myself included, think it should have stayed here.

So here we are, a thread to call for it to be moved back here, where it is more active and more easily seen and enjoyed.
YES! I have no idea at all why it was moved to a section of the forum that more or less meant "death" for the thread.

YES! I have no idea at all why it was moved to a section of the forum that more or less meant "death" for the thread.

I absolutely agree.... Also there need to be fewer subsection in this Forum.

Agree, general forums are where new players start looking for info. That thread contains so much awesomeness, it is the best motivation to deep digger into the game.

Been there just two month ago
Yes please. I never ever remember to check it and when I do there are hardly any new pictures anymore.

I tend to check it when it's in here, but not down in that... deep hole *shudders*

That's because most experienced people, know it's there, but all the newbies don't know it exists.

It's also just more "common' for people to view it in GD.
Agreed. Kinda confusing why it was moved.
Maybe just start a new thread of the same kind, it was getting rather big.
It was moved 3 times already and it always came back.

YES! I have no idea at all why it was moved to a section of the forum that more or less meant "death" for the thread.
I tend to check it when it's in here, but not down in that... deep hole *shudders*

What's wrong with Fan Works?

Why was it moved to Fan Works? Probably because it belongs in Fan Works!

If someone would start a similar topic, lets say with video's, in the general forum it would be moved to Fan Works within one or two days. Guaranteed! Why should "Show off your awesome KSP pictures!" be an exception to this?

Because "fan works" is a dark alley on the site, forums suffer when fragmented too much.

It appeals to someones ocd I'm sure, but GD is where everyone is.

Apparently the mods don't care what people think though seeing as this thread was also moved.
And now it's even worse, this poll was moved to the Forum Forum section where not even 1% of people read.

Hey, everyone.

The thread in question was moved during a small cleanup of the top of the General section. We feel that putting that thread into the more appropriate Fan Works section will encourage everyone to venture in there to both view and share their excellent creations more frequently. If things take a big dip, well, that can change, but at the moment, that's where the thread resides.

As for this thread, this section was more appropriate for it. Section cleanup has been a bit of a discussion as of late, so if you have any suggestions for it, please turn that into a separate thread.

...If things take a big dip, well, that can change, but at the moment, that's where the thread resides...

I wanted to make a difference and opened the thread about user-made funny KSP stuff, but so far, zero replies, and this monstrosity of a thread grows like a tumor.

- what is the point of rovers on moons/planet with low gravity? [14-01-14, should be in Questions and Tutorials]

- The only thing thing that I care to see in .24 [02-01-14, should be in Suggestions and Development]

Edited January 16, 2014 by Yakuzi

First thread, yeah, probably. Second thread, mmmh, maybe. Third thread, definitely not. It's discussing KSP's performance on different machines, not its development; it's fine where it is. The final one is almost certainly going to be a matter of opinion and should be discussed, as it doesn't have a clear definitive answer.

We move what we can when we can. We're not machines, we don't always catch everything, and not everything is very clear-cut; it is not uncommon for us to discuss whether or not something should be moved for a bit before actually moving it. If you see something you think needs moving, go hit the Report Post button on the OP and say so. That's one of many reasons why it's there.

But the thing is, the community drives the forum, at some point people either accept that, or their community dries up.

Happens all the time.
That doesn't mean a couple of members of the community have veto rights over the administration of the forums. The forum has over 5000 active members. A few do not speak for the opinions of all.

Alright, want to hear my personal opinion? We have way too many subforums. Yes. I've been saying this for months and I personally really don't like the "vicious stance against threads in a slightly wrong place" that sometimes shines through. Why? Well, because even we sometimes just don't know where a thread would be best suited. Way too many forums with quite some overlap on the one hand and huge gaps on the other between these forums.

That does not, however, mean we should dump everything into KSPGen. Just because people can't be arsed to leave KSPGen for a bit doesn't mean we should just kill everything else and just have one huge dump. Threads go where they belong, even if "where they belong" is utterly nonsensical because of the mess that has been created - but we can, at a later point (once we have a better solution to this all), change the mess and tidy it up. We can't really do that when KSPGen is essentially the only forum ever with absolutely everything posted in it.
